Experimental techniques.Manipulations: Under dry nitrogen, standard Schlenk line techniques or in an argon-filled MBraun glovebox
Experimental techniques.Glassware preparation: Dried at 180 °C, evacuated, back filled with nitrogen gas
Experimental techniques.Schlenk vessels: Equipped with threaded Rodaviss joints and J. Youngs taps
Experimental techniques.Filtrations: Stainless steel cannula filters with glass micro-fiber filter paper and PTFE tape
Experimental techniques.NMR tubes: J. Youngs NMR tubes or airtight screw top NMR tubes
Experimental techniques.Contamination prevention: Reactions performed with new glassware, cleaned in 'iron-only' base and acid baths

Solvents and reagents preparation.Dry solvents: CH2Cl2, acetonitrile, toluene, diethyl ether, THF, hexane (passed over alumina)
Solvents and reagents preparation.Other solvents: Dried over molecular sieves, except acetone (distilled from boric anhydride)
Solvents and reagents preparation.Deoxygenation: All solvents deoxygenated prior to use

Analytical techniques.GC-FID: Agilent Technologies 7820A GC-FID, calibration with n-dodecane as internal standard
Analytical techniques.NMR: Jeol ECS 300, Jeol ECS 400, Varian 400-MR, Varian VNMR S500 spectrometers
Analytical techniques.FT-IR: Mettler Toledo ReactIR 15 with AgX fiber and DiComp or SiComp tip probe
Analytical techniques.UV-Vis: Ocean Optics TP300-series transmission probe or 1 cm quartz glass cuvette

Custom-made equipment.Jacketed Schlenks: For kinetic experiments and reaction monitoring at constant temperature
Custom-made equipment.Experimental setup: For reaction monitoring using in situ FT-IR or UV-Vis spectroscopy (Supplementary Figures 1 and 2)

Chemicals.4-Tolylmagnesium bromide solution: 1.0 M in THF, titrated prior to use
Chemicals.Methylmagnesium bromide solution: 3.0 M in diethyl ether, titrated prior to use
Chemicals.Other phosphines and ligands: 1,3-Bis(diphenylphosphino)propane, cis-1,2-bis(diphenylphosphino)ethylene, MeDuphos, iPrDuphos, diphenylchlorophosphine, n-butyllithium, trans-1,2-bis(diphenylphosphino)ethylene, 1,2-Bis(diphenylphosphino)benzene, norphos, 1,2-bis(bis(3,5-di-tert-butylphenyl)phosphino)benzene (sciopp), 3,4-dibromothiophene, potassium graphite, 3,4-bis(diphenylphosphino)thiophene (dpth), Li(4-tolyl), synthesized according to literature procedures

General instrumentation.Elemental analysis: Euro Vector EA3000 elemental analyzer or Elemental Microanalysis Ltd, UK
General instrumentation.UV-Vis spectra: Ocean Optics TP300-series transmission probe or 1 cm quartz glass cuvette
General instrumentation.Electron microscopy: JEOL 2100 TEM, Gatan Orius SC1000 digital camera, Oxford Instruments Aztec X-ray system for EDX analyses
